content:
ToolStripItemRenderEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that handles the events that render the background of objects derived from ToolStripItem in the ToolStripRenderer class.

In this Article

public delegate void ToolStripItemRenderEventHandler(object sender, ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
System.Delegate
ToolStripItemRenderEventHandler

Remarks

The ToolStripItemRenderEventHandler represents the method that handles the following events:

  • RenderButtonBackground
  • RenderDropDownButtonBackground
  • RenderItemBackground
  • RenderLabelBackground
  • RenderMenuItemBackground
  • RenderOverflowButtonBackground
  • RenderSplitButtonBackground

    When you create a ToolStripItemRenderEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that handles the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see Events.
